s1: This course studies the standard models for the layered approach to communication between autonomous machines in a network, and the main characteristics of data transmission across various physical link types.
s2: Understand the main principles and concepts in at least two areas of computer science that are being actively shaped by research.

s1: It considers how to design networks and protocols for diverse situations, analyses several application and support protocols from a distributed systems viewpoint, and identifies significant problem areas in networked communications.
s2: Understand the main principles and concepts in at least two areas of computer science that are being actively shaped by research.

s1: Topics include: communication network architectures, signalling and modulation across physical media, real-world local and wide-area networks, internet protocol fundamentals, performance and monitoring of networks, routing, network security, and application protocols for distributed systems including web, email, video, internet-of-everything and other contemporary network topics.
s2: Understand the main principles and concepts in at least two areas of computer science that are being actively shaped by research.

s1: Understand and describe the layered protocol model.
s2: Understand the main principles and concepts in at least two areas of computer science that are being actively shaped by research.

s1: Describe, analyse and compare a number of datalink, network, and transport layer protocols.
s2: Understand the main principles and concepts in at least two areas of computer science that are being actively shaped by research.

s1: Program network communication services for client/server and other application layouts.
s2: This course provides students with hands-on experience of being a researcher in the computing discipline.

s1: Describe and analyse various related technical, administrative and social aspects of specific computer network protocols from standards documents and other primary materials found through research.
s2: Understand the main principles and concepts in at least two areas of computer science that are being actively shaped by research.

s1: Design and/or analyse networks and services for homes, data centres, IoT/IoE, LANs and WANs.
s2: Have a basis of the knowledge and skills in research projects that can be built upon for more substantial projects.
